title: Ribosome Purification for OnePot PURE cell-free system
title_html: Ribosome Purification for OnePot PURE cell-free system

protocol.title: Ribosome Purification for OnePot PURE cell-free system
protocol.title_html: Ribosome Purification for OnePot PURE cell-free system

source.description: Add 100ml of LB medium to the 1L Erlenmeyer flask

source.body:
Work under flame
Sterilize the bench with 70% Ethanol

source.description: Inoculate the LB with 10μl of A19 E. coli strain kept in glycerol stock
Incubate overnight (at least 12 hours) at 37oC rotating at 250rmp
Add 2l of LB medium to each of the two 5l flasks

source.body:
Work under flame
Sterilize the bench with 70% Ethanol

source.description: Inoculate the flasks with 30ml of the A19 E. Coli culture each

source.body:
To store some of the remaining bacteria:
Add to the desired tubes same quantity of the bacterial sample and 40% Glycerol stock and mix.
Then you may store them at -80oC for future use.

source.description: Incubate the flasks for 2 hours at 37oC rotating at 180rpm
Test the bacterial sample with OD600 Spectrophotometer
Add 1ml of the sample to a cuvette and measure it
If the measurement is lower than 1.0 continue incubating and after the appropriate time repeat the measurement

source.body: Take into account that E.coli has a doubling time of about 20-30 minutes

source.description: Centrifuge the bacterial sample for 20min with 6000 RCF at 4oC

source.body: Precool the centrifuge to 4oC before using as the sample is quit sensitive

source.description: Remove the supernatant from the tubes .The cells should be shaped into a pellet on the wall of the tube
Use 40ml of the buffer to resuspend the cells and then with the another 10ml wash the tubes to collect any cells left attached to the tubes
Add 25μl of β-Mercaptoethanol to 50ml of Suspension buffer

source.body: The final concentration of β-Mercaptoethanol in the buffers should always be 7mM before each use

source.description: Gather the sample into two tubes (appr. 25-35ml liquid in each)

source.body: At this point we can store the samples at -80oC overnight

source.description: Sonicate each tube on ice with 20s on 20s off for an active time of 4min at 70% of total power

source.body: Clean the sonicator by applying one operation cycle to milli-Q water
It is very important to keep the cells on ice to avoid damaging the proteins as they are very sensitive to temperature

source.description: Centrifuge the samples for 20min with 20000RCF at 4oC

source.body: Precool centrifuge at 4oC
Debris are gathered on the walls in pellet shape

source.description: Collect the sample into a single beaker and measure the total volume (e.g. 60ml)

Prepare the same quantity of High salt suspension buffer by adding 2000x concentration of β-Mercaptoethanol (e.g. add 30μl of β-Mercaptoethanol to 60ml of High salt suspension buffer) and mix the solutions.
Centrifuge the samples for 20min with 20000RCF at 4oC

source.body: Precool centrifuge at 4oC
Due to the use of the High salt buffer the unwanted debris will be precipitated

source.description: Filter the supernatant through a syringe filter with a 0.22μm PES membrane and gather the sample to a single Beaker

Preparation of the purifier: Clean the input filter of the AKTA Purifier
Set the ambient temperature to 4oC
Connect three HiTrap Butyl HP column (5ml) in series to the purifier
Preparation of the buffers: Add 75μl of β-Mercaptoethanol to 150ml of Buffer C
Add 60μl of β-Mercaptoethanol to 120ml of Buffer D
Remove the ethanol in the columns with 45ml of Milli-Q water

source.body: Set up the flow rate as 4 ml/min (Monitor the pressure while running the column and do not exceed the Max limit of pressure of columns.)

source.description: Wash the column with 45mL of wash buffer 1 (100% buffer C)
Wash the column with 75mL of wash buffer 2 (80 buffer C, 20% buffer D)
Add approximately 90% of the lysate sample to the system
Elute the ribosomes with 60ml of elution buffer 1 (50% buffer C, 50% buffer D) and then with 60ml of elution buffer 2 (100% buffer D)
The eluted ribosomes are collected into tubes of 4.5ml
Pick the tubes that have the biggest absorbance in wave length 280nm
Wash with 45ml of milli-Q water
Wash with 45ml of NaOH (1M)
Wash with 45ml of milli-Q water
Wash with 45ml of Acetic Acid (0.1 M)
Wash with 45ml of milli-Q water
Equilibrate with 45ml of Ethanol 20%

source.body: After the cleaning the column is stored at 4oC in 20% ethanol and can be reused

source.description: Add 14μl of β-Mercaethanol to 28ml of Cushion buffer and mix

source.body: We will use two tubes for Ultracentrifuge

source.description: Place 14ml of Cushion Buffer to each of the Ultracentrifuge tubes
Carefully place the ribosomes solution on top of the cushion buffer and make sure that we still see the separation layer
Ultracentrifuge for 16 hours with 24000RPM (100000RCF) at 4oC
Discard the liquid

source.body: The pellet of ribosomes might not be visible at this point

source.description: Add 2μl of β-Mercaethanol to 4ml of Ribosome Buffer and mix
Add 500μl of Ribosome buffer to the wall of the tube and slightly spin to wash the cushion buffer on each tube and then discard the liquid
Repeat step No 39
Add 100μl of Ribosome buffer to each tube and resuspend the cells with a magnetic stirrer on ice for 10min at 200rpm
Collect the samples to a single tube ( Tube No1)
Wash the centrifuge tubes with 100μl of Ribosome Buffer and add that to another tube (Tube No2)
Load the solution to a 0.5mL Amicon Ultra filter with 3kDa molecular weight cutoff and centrifuge at 14000RCF for 10min at 4

source.body: Use two separate filter for Tube No1 and No2

source.description: Dilute 1μl of the concentrated solution to 99μl of ribosome buffer (or milli-Q water?) and measure the absorbance at 260nm
Optionally , if the absorbance of Tube No2 is more than 10% of the one measured for the Tube No1 you can mix the two samples and repeat steps 44 and 45
Adjust the final concentration 10uM by dilution with ribosome buffer

source.body: Absorbance of 10 corresponds to 23uM concentration

source.description: Aliquote the final solution according to your needs (0.9μl are needed for one 5μl reaction) and store at -80oC
Equilibrate columns with 60 ml buffer C

description: In this protocol we explain the procedure of ribosomes purification with the method of hydrophobic interaction chromatography (HIC) so they can be used for a PURE cell-free system.
